definition: to tear
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
(phonetic)/this
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
to rip apart/to tear/laceration/rent
to tear apart
to tear/to rip
to tear up/to rip up/too shred
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to tear to shreds
lit. to tear the ticket/to kill a hostage (usually held for ransom)
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)
to tear up/to tear to pieces
(slang) (lit.) to tear cunt/(fig.) (of females) to have a catfight/to have a bitch fight

sentences.english: It resists tearing, flex-cut growth, creep and abrasion.
sentences.chinese: 它抗撕，柔性切割增長，蠕變和磨損。

sentences.english: I knelt there, ripped up the poem, and threw the pieces of paper into the air, crying (really hard).
sentences.chinese: 我跪拜它，然後撕了它，把碎片灑向空中，大聲痛哭。

sentences.english: There’s a rip in my luggage.
sentences.chinese: 我的行李被撕了道口子。

sentences.english: Is stitch tear resistance reported in "Newton's"?
sentences.chinese: 車縫位抗撕力度的結果是否以“牛頓”爲單位。？

sentences.english: Angry workers tore the notice down from the noticeboard.
sentences.chinese: 憤怒的工人把佈告欄上的通告撕了下來。

sentences.english: Objective To compare different therapeutic methods in scalp avulsion.
sentences.chinese: 目的比較頭皮撕脫傷的不同治療方法。

sentences.english: Tear the tinfoil paper cigarette box lined with 20 cigarettes.
sentences.chinese: 撕錫箔紙菸盒內整齊的排列着20根香菸。

sentences.english: Professor Smith served as adviser to the President.
sentences.chinese: 史密撕教授贈做過總統的拓別顧問。

sentences.english: Heart, the struggle to tear Qin crack lung pain.
sentences.chinese: 心，糾纏着撕吢裂肺的疼。

sentences.english: Steam the chicken breast, leave to cool and shred.
sentences.chinese: 雞胸肉蒸熟，待涼後撕成細絲。

sentences.english: Objective Introduce a method to repair hand avulsion.
sentences.chinese: 目的介紹一種修復手部撕脫傷的方法。

sentences.english: He tore at the cover of the parcel.
She glanced at it and then tore it into pieces.
sentences.chinese: 然而她瞟了一眼協議，就把它撕了個粉碎。

sentences.english: A hole was torn in your jacket. Let me stitch up the torn jacket for you.
sentences.chinese: 你的上衣撕了個口子，我給你縫縫吧。

sentences.english: Is torn on superior to Posting Duan Zhenguo come, want to prove themselves on the battlefield.
sentences.chinese: 對上級來的調令段振國也撕了，要在戰場上證明自己。

sentences.english: I nearly fear to tear the tearful girl's test IT.
sentences.chinese: 我幾乎畏懼撕誰人兩淚汪汪的女孩的試卷。

definition: (slang) (lit.) to tear cunt/(fig.) (of females) to have a catfight/to have a bitch fight
to break off or break open sth with one's hands/(fig.) to break off (a relationship)
to tear out (and throw away)/to rip away
to peel/to skin/to tear/to pull down/to cling to (sth on which one is climbing)/to dig
to rake up/to steal/to braise/to crawl
variant of 逼[bi1]/to compel/to pressure
to take the lid off/to expose/to unmask
to tear apart
to tear/to rip
to tear to shreds
to tear up/to tear to pieces
(Internet slang) to attack verbally/to publicly criticize/to call out
dislike/hate
variant of 扯[che3]/to pull/to tear
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi

to ridicule/to mock

hidden details/dirty tricks/dark secrets
